author: Staff Reporter
text:
A year after he was shot dead outside his home in Kolhapur, the kin of veteran CPI leader Govind Pansare has said the pace of the investigation is tardy.

Alleging “apathy” on part of the investigators, the family of the 81-year-old leader demanded the appointment of a special public prosecutor to oversee the trial.

“We are unhappy with the lackadaisical attitude adopted by the investigators and the State government. We demand that the Special Investigation Team (SIT) formed to probe the murder not be burdened with additional responsibilities,” said Megha, Pansare’s daughter-in-law.

While Pansare succumbed to his wounds at Mumbai’s Breach Candy hospital, his wife Uma, who was grievously wounded in the head, suffers from paralysis.

The first arrest in the case was made only after a lapse of seven months, after the SIT nabbed Sameer Gaikwad, an activist of the Sanatan Sanstha.
title: Pansare kin seek special prosecutor for trial
